issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

resolution.description: The described issue is not actually a problem - it is as designed.
resolution.name: Not A Problem

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: Debug log in {{scanIntermediateDirectory}} lacks the confirmation of debug mode is enabled or not.
fields.summary: Lack of confirmation of debug log enabled in HistoryFileManager

This message was automatically generated.

Hello [~lewuathe].

Thank you for the patch, but I believe this is unnecessary.  The {{if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()}} check is used as a way to prevent execution of code where the act of creating the logged string is dynamic and costly.  This might involve lots of string concatenations or computationally intensive {{toString}} implementations in logged objects.  In the example here, it's just logging a hard-coded string literal.  There is no string concatentation or expensive computation, so there is no benefit to putting the guard around the log statement.

I am resolving this as Not a Problem.
[~cnauroth] Oh, I see. Thank you for sharing the reason and background.
